title: Drawing, "Wallpaper Design", 1840–60
medium: Brush and gouache, graphite on white paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mary Hearn Greims
description: The gray panel is decorated with vertical rows of rising waves, which are connected horizontally by petals. The waves consist of leaf boughs, and the petals are small sized, at left, of an indistinct material but great petals, at right. Rosettes between boughs, of different designs at left and at right, decorate the oblique low-pointed ovoids. A stem with alternate pairs of red and of vine leaves lies across the top; its upper part is shown against the gray background.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Wallpaper Design", 1840–60.Brush and gouache, graphite on white paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mary Hearn Greims. 1940-120-19.
